text: Peter Joshua Sculthorpe (29 June 1929 - 8 August 2014) was an Australian composer. He was best known for orchestral and chamber music, such as Earth Cry (1986) and Kakadu (1988). He was a classical-styled opera and ballet composer. Sculthorpe was born in suburban Launceston, Tasmania. He studied in Melbourne, Victoria and at the Wadham College, Oxford in the United Kingdom. Sculthorpe died after a long illness on 8 August 2014 in Sydney, New South Wales. He was 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1929 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Australian composers Category:Classical musicians Category:Disease-related deaths in Sydney Category:Officers of the Order of the British Empire Category:Order of Australia Category:People from Launceston, Tasmania
title: Peter Sculthorpe
